data.text:
The first day of the festival focused on the fijian cinema. Larry Thomas and Vilsoni Hereniko are both film directors and shared their opinions on Fiji. The debate was particularly rich in emotions. Number of the day One country, three movies, three... More

The first day of the festival focused on the fijian cinema. Larry Thomas and Vilsoni Hereniko are both film directors and shared their opinions on Fiji. The debate was particularly rich in emotions. Number of the day One country, three movies, three styles. Yesterday afternoon, the line-up gave us an overview of the potential of the fijian cinema. A mix of styles, between entertainment and claims for cultural identity. First, there was Bollywood, with a fijian touch. An impossible love-story that carries us in a universe spicy and sour. The recipe is well-known and it works all the time. Then came a short film : Enduring Hope by Larry Thomas relates the friendship between two young fijians with different origin. They face land tenure conflicts and customary problems. « I treated this theme because nobody talks about it in the country », said the film-maker. An ambitious cinema that tackles the clichés. Finally, the third movie was ‘The Land has eyes’ by Vilsoni Hereniko. Less
